channel.title: DevHawk tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from DevHawk.

item.description:
I think @kdrum wrote something once about change happens two ways: crisis response or a slow bore thru wood

That concept plus this MLK quote help me remember that worthy change is neither easy nor quick https://t.co/78dZ0KbYZ8
item.source:markdown:
I think @kdrum wrote something once about change happens two ways: crisis response or a slow bore thru wood
That concept plus this MLK quote help me remember that worthy change is neither easy nor quick https://t.co/78dZ0KbYZ8

item.description:
Today's Workout : 345# squat, 135# overhead, 405# deadlift. 5x5 worksets (1x5 deadlift workset) #StrongLifts5x5

Also did 2x455#x10 sec heavy walk outs. 345# feels a lot lighter after having 455# on my back https://t.co/a3rgSn8Rvu

I wanted to be at 1000# combined bench, deadlift and squat by may. COVID threw a wrench in that plan. But I'm now up to 955#x5 combined.

My best ever combined was 995# for reps in 2017. Thinking I could get there and beyond by end of the year.
item.source:markdown:
Today's Workout : 345# squat, 135# overhead, 405# deadlift. 5x5 worksets (1x5 deadlift workset) #StrongLifts5x5
Also did 2x455#x10 sec heavy walk outs. 345# feels a lot lighter after having 455# on my back https://t.co/a3rgSn8Rvu
I wanted to be at 1000# combined bench, deadlift and squat by may. COVID threw a wrench in that plan. But I'm now up to 955#x5 combined.
My best ever combined was 995# for reps in 2017. Thinking I could get there and beyond by end of the year.

item.description:
Nice to see that @msonenote sync engine is back online this morning.

Using Word + OneDrive worked fine yesterday as a one-off stop gap, but OneNote is just better for this kind of daily tracking - when the sync service is online anyway.
item.source:markdown:
Nice to see that @msonenote sync engine is back online this morning.
Using Word + OneDrive worked fine yesterday as a one-off stop gap, but OneNote is just better for this kind of daily tracking - when the sync service is online anyway.

item.description:
This list of weight training "commandments" from @bonvecstrength rocks https://t.co/I2k4msowCy

My only note: under "Thou Shalt Master the Basics of Nutrition", maybe add something about eating more beans and veggies?

Otherwise <chef's kiss>

Today’s workout: 285# squat, 205# bench, 185# barbell rows. 5x5 worksets #stronglifts5x5

I went lighter than usual on squats because I'm doing back to back workouts this week. Going for my normal squat progression tomorrow morning
item.source:markdown:
Today’s workout: 285# squat, 205# bench, 185# barbell rows. 5x5 worksets #stronglifts5x5
I went lighter than usual on squats because I'm doing back to back workouts this week. Going for my normal squat progression tomorrow morning

item.description:
It's rare, but it SUCKS when @msonenote sync infrastructure is offline...as it appears to be now.

@msonenote I use OneNote to store my workout info - write it down @ home on my laptop, refer to it @ gym on my phone.

Luckily, @onedrive sync is still online, so I'm just using Word for today's workout instead of OneNote

Today's Workout : 5x5x325# squats, 5x5x325# overhead press, 1x5x375# deadlift. #StrongLifts5x5

Those weights are 5% off recent pace. I take it easier on Tuesdays because of Sunday hockey. My 50+ year old body doesn't recover like it used to .

As @garyshort pointed out, the 325# overhead press is a typo. Should be 125#
item.source:markdown:
Today's Workout : 5x5x325# squats, 5x5x325# overhead press, 1x5x375# deadlift. #StrongLifts5x5
Those weights are 5% off recent pace. I take it easier on Tuesdays because of Sunday hockey. My 50+ year old body doesn't recover like it used to .
As @garyshort pointed out, the 325# overhead press is a typo. Should be 125#

item.description:
Today's workout: 340# squat, 200# bench, 180# barbell rows. 5x5 worksets #strongLifts5x5

Haven't posted workout in a while, but since @gsmachado wondered if I broke my phone on gym equipment, I figured I should post what has actually been going on at the gym 3 days per week.
item.source:markdown:
Today's workout: 340# squat, 200# bench, 180# barbell rows. 5x5 worksets #strongLifts5x5
Haven't posted workout in a while, but since @gsmachado wondered if I broke my phone on gym equipment, I figured I should post what has actually been going on at the gym 3 days per week.

item.description: @gsmachado @GrantShares @Neo_Blockchain @coz_official @NEOnewstoday @NeoResearch_NEO @ax_labs @rendongliu @NE0NEXT @neospcc @Red4Sec @john_devadoss I dropped it after I got home from the gym..slipped out of my hand as I was grabbing groceries from car, so that's more to blame than the squats

item.description:
One of Tony's castmates was wearing a Browncoats t shirt with "I aim to misbehave" on the back. I was thus inspired to watch Serenity.

The first 25 minutes of Serenity are stunning. The rest of the movie is great, but the opening is absolutely perfect.

https://t.co/3r6SAAY83Z

https://t.co/mXjNGvbH7U
item.source:markdown:

item.description:
SpongeBob the Musical is a truly ridiculous show. Regardless, Issaquah Kidstage is a fantastic production of this ridiculous show. So glad that Tony has been a part of it.

I am privileged that I often get to hear other people cheer for my kids. Patrick on ice, Tony on stage.
item.source:markdown:
SpongeBob the Musical is a truly ridiculous show. Regardless, Issaquah Kidstage is a fantastic production of this ridiculous show. So glad that Tony has been a part of it.
I am privileged that I often get to hear other people cheer for *my* kids. Patrick on ice, Tony on stage.

item.description: Opening night, Village Theatre Kidstage SummerStock production of SpongeBob SquarePants the Musical... Featuring my son #ProudDad https://t.co/2Ot1ZDKZms
